intro: Monnina fastigiata, commonly known as the upright monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant has a compact, upright growth habit with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Monnina fastigiata is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
